(11)  That is wider than six and one-half (6.5) feet on the public streets in the Campus Corner area between 10:00 a.m. and 3:00 a.m. Monday through Saturday. 
a.  The Campus Corner area shall be defined as the 500 blocks of South University Boulevard and Buchanan Avenue, the 200 and 300 blocks of Boyd Street, the 700 block of Asp Avenue, the 300 block of White Street and the alleyway between Asp Avenue and DeBarr Avenue from Boyd Street to Duffy Street; 
b.  Part (6)[b] above does not apply. 
(Ord. No. 0-7273-67; Ord. No. 0-7778-23; Ord. No. 0-7879-80; Ord. No. 0-7980-19; Ord. No. 0-8384-14; Ord. No. 0-8485-84; Ord. No. 0-8586-43; Ord. No. 0-0304-11; Ord. No. 0-1617-19, § 2) 
Cross reference- Unlawful parking of vehicle in taxicab, bus or limousine stand or stop, § 13-2007. 
Sec. 20-808. - Parking, standing or stopping; opening doors of vehicle. 
    No person shall open the door of a motor vehicle on the side available to moving traffic unless and until it is reasonably safe to do so, nor shall such doors remain open for a period of time longer than necessary to load or unload persons or property. 
(Ord. No. 0-4273-67) 
Sec. 20-809. - Stopping when emerging from alley, building or driveway; yielding right-of-way. 
(a)  No person shall emerge from an alley, building, or driveway without immediately stopping the vehicle prior to driving onto any sidewalk area extending across such alley-way, driveway, or in front of such building. 
(b)  No person complying with the above subsection shall then enter upon the roadway without yielding the right-of-way to any: 
(1)  Pedestrian crossing or about to cross that sidewalk area, or 
(2)  Vehicle approaching so closely as to constitute an immediate hazard during time that person is entering the roadway. 
(Ord. No. 0-7273-67) 
Sec. 20-810. - Stopping for stop sign, yielding right-of-way. 
(a)  No person shall enter a stop intersection indicated by a stop sign without immediately stopping: 
(1)  At the crosswalk on the near side of the intersection, or 
(2)  At a clearly marked stop line, or 
(3)  At a point nearest the intersecting roadways where the person has a view of approaching traffic, if there be neither crosswalk nor clearly marked stop line. 
(b)  No person complying with the above subsection shall then enter that vehicle into the intersection without yielding the right-of-way to any vehicle which has entered that intersection from another street, or which is approaching so closely as to constitute an immediate hazard during the time when the person is moving across or within the intersection. 
(Ord. No. 0-7273-67) 
Sec. 20-811. - Stopping or slowing: Use of signals. 
(a)  No person shall stop or suddenly slow a vehicle except upon his continuously giving a signal of such intention when there is an opportunity to give such signal. 
(b)  The signal or an intention to stop or suddenly slow may be given by means of either a signal lamp or by the hand and arm of the driver, in which case such hand and arm signal shall be in accordance with state law. 
(Ord. No. 0-7273-67) 
Sec. 20-812. - Stopping for yield sign, yielding right-of-way. 
(a)  No person shall enter a yield intersection indicated by a yield sign without slowing to a speed reasonable for existing conditions or stopping if so required for safety. 
(b)  No person complying with the above subsection shall then enter that vehicle into the intersection without yielding the right-of-way to any vehicle which has entered that intersection from another street, or which is approaching so closely as to constitute an immediate hazard during the time when the person is moving across or within the intersection. 
(Ord. No. 0-7273-67) 
Sec. 20-813. - Separate offenses. 
(a)  Metered parking: Each elapse of one (1) hour of parking at an expired parking meter shall constitute a separate and distinct violation for which multiple tickets may be issued. 
(b)  Timed parking: Each elapse of the specified period of parking at a timed parking zone shall constitute a separate and distinct violation for which multiple tickets may be issued. 
(c)  All other parking violations: Each elapse of two (2) hours shall constitute a separate and distinct violation for which multiple tickets may be issued. 
(Ord. No. 0-7273-67; Ord. No. 0-7475-37; Ord. No. 0-8485-84; Ord. No. 0-9394-48) 
Cross reference- Citations and fines for parking violations, § 14-311. 
Sec. 20-814. - Negligent parking. 
    No person shall park, cause to be parked, stop or leave unattended any vehicle: 
(1)  In such a manner as to endanger life, limb, person or property; 
(2)  In such a manner as to endanger or interfere with the lawful traffic course of the streets. 
(Ord. No. 0-7778-25) 
Sec. 20-815. - Parking of trucks, trailers, buses and recreational vehicles. 
    No truck, trailer, recreational vehicle, bus or other vehicle exceeding two (2) axles and/or in excess of a length of twenty (20) feet or more shall be allowed to park on any street, the principal use of which is for residential living, at any time except for the immediate loading or unloading of persons or materials and only then when not in violation of any other provision of this chapter. 
(Ord. No. 0-8990-17) 
Sec. 20-816. - Parking, current registration. 
    No person shall park, stop or stand a vehicle upon any public street without that vehicle being registered in accordance with the Code of the City and the laws of the State of Oklahoma. 
(Ord. No. O-0304-43) 
ARTICLE IX. - PEDESTRIANS 

Sec. 20-901. - Pedestrians subject to traffic control devices. 
    Pedestrians shall be subject to all traffic control devices, including railroad crossing gates or barriers; but at all other places they shall be granted the rights and be subject to the provisions of this article. 
(Ord. No. 0-7273-67) 
Sec. 20-902. - Soliciting rides or business prohibited. 
    No person shall stand in a roadway to solicit a ride, employment, or business from the occupant of any vehicle. 
(Ord. No. 0-7273-67) 
Sec. 20-903. - Walking along roadways. 
(a)  No person shall walk along and upon any roadway when adjacent sidewalks are provided. 
(b)  When adjacent sidewalks are not provided, any person walking along and upon a highway shall walk, when practicable, only on the left side of the roadway or its shoulder facing any traffic approaching from the opposite direction. 
(Ord. No. 0-7273-67) 
Sec. 20-904. - Pedestrian to yield. 
    No pedestrian shall cross a roadway at any point other than within a marked crosswalk or within an unmarked crosswalk at any intersection without yielding the right-of-way to all vehicles upon the roadway. 
(Ord. No. 0-7273-67) 
Sec. 20-905. - Crossing the street. 
(a)  No pedestrian shall suddenly leave a curb or other place of safety and walk or run into the path of any vehicle which is so close that it is impossible for the driver to yield. 
(b)  No pedestrian shall cross a roadway at any place other than by a route at right angles to the curb or by the shortest route to the opposite curb, except in a crosswalk. 
(c)  No pedestrian shall cross a roadway intersection diagonally unless authorized by official traffic control devices, and when so authorized to cross diagonally, said pedestrian shall cross only in accordance with the official traffic control device pertaining to such crossing movement. 
(Ord. No. 0-7273-67) 
Sec. 20-906. - Use of crosswalk required in certain situations. 
(a)  No pedestrian shall cross at any place other than in a crosswalk: 
(1)  Between adjacent intersections at which traffic control signals are in operation; 
(2)  Upon any through street. 
(b)  Pedestrians shall move, whenever practicable, upon the right half of a crosswalk. 
(Ord. No. 0-7273-67) 
Sec. 20-907. - Pedestrian right-of-way in crosswalks. 
    When traffic control signals are not in place or not in operation, the driver of a vehicle shall yield the right-of-way, slowing down or stopping, if so needed to yield, to a pedestrian crossing the roadway within a crosswalk when that pedestrian is upon the half of the roadway upon which the vehicle is traveling, or when the pedestrian is approaching so closely from the opposite half of the roadway as to be in danger. 
(Ord. No. 0-7273-67) 
ARTICLE X. - SPEED REGULATIONS[6] 

Footnotes: 
--- (6) --- 
Cross reference- Administrative fine, in lieu of court appearance, for speeding violations, § 14-310(d)(2). 

Sec. 20-1001. - Speed limits generally; excessive speed. 
    Except as otherwise provided in this chapter, no person shall drive any vehicle at speeds greater than the posted speed limit upon the highways, roads, streets, or portions thereof. 
(Ord. No. 0-7273-67; Ord. No. 0-8485-84; Ord. No. 0-0203-55, § 4; Ord. No. 0-0405-03, § 1) 
Sec. 20-1002. - Speed limits specifically. 
(a)  Except as otherwise provided in this chapter, no person shall drive any vehicle at speeds greater than the following upon the following highways, roads, streets, or portions thereof: 
(1)  On all alleys unless otherwise posted ..... 15 mph 
(2)  On all streets where school zones and school crossing zones are designated, on days when school is in session, between the hours of 8:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m., unless otherwise posted ..... 20 mph 
(3)  On all streets except those specifically listed in section 20-1002 and upon all streets adjacent to schools at times other than specified in item (2) ..... 25 mph 
(4)  On all section line roads except those specifically listed in section 20-1002 ..... 50 mph 
(5)  On all federal and state highways, except those portions within the city limits specifically listed below, the state traffic speed regulations shall apply. 
(b)  Specific speed limits not otherwise designated shall be set by the Director of Public Works or his designee based on pertinent traffic data obtained through traffic engineering studies. Three (3) copies of those specific speed limits shall be kept on file at the Office of Public Works and the City Clerk's Office at all times. 
(c)  Where any city, state, or federal road or highway shall be under construction, maintenance, or repair or when a detour shall have been designated by reason of construction, maintenance, or repairs in progress, the Director of Public Works, or his designee, may establish a maximum safe, careful, and prudent speed on the basis of engineering and traffic investigation for said construction zone. No person shall drive any vehicle upon the portion of the road, highway, or detour at a speed in excess of the speed so determined and posted. For purposes of this section, "repair, maintenance, or construction zone" means any location where repair, maintenance or construction work is actually in progress and workers present. 
(Ord. No. 0-7273-67; Ord. No. 0-7475-49; Ord. No. 0-7677-55; Ord. No. 0-7980-10; Ord. No. 0-7980-39; Ord. No. 0-7980-40; Ord. No. 0-7980-41; Ord. No. 0-7980-42; Ord. No. 0-7980-43; Ord. No. 0-7980-70; Ord. No. 0-8081-18; Ord. No. 0-8182-40; Ord. No. 0-8384-15; Ord. No. 0-8384-40; Ord. No. 0-8384-43; Ord. No. 0-8485-83; Ord. No. 0-8485-84; Ord. No. 0-8586-7; Ord. No. 0-8586-11; Ord. No. 0-8586-45; Ord. No. 0-9394-16; Ord. No. 0-9394-48; Ord. No. 0-0203-55, § 5; Ord. No. 0-0405-03, § 2; Ord. No. 0-1314-31, § 1) 
Sec. 20-1003. - Persons exempt from this article. 
    Persons exempt from the provisions of sections 20-1001 and 20-1002 of this Code are those driving authorized emergency vehicles in accordance with section 20-112 of this Code. 
(Ord. No. A 0-7273-67) 
Sec. 20-1004. - Speed not to exceed that which is reasonable under existing conditions. 
(a)  Notwithstanding the maximum speed limits enumerated in this article, no person shall drive a vehicle upon any alley, highway, roadway, street or public parking area at a speed greater than or less than is reasonable or prudent under the conditions then existing, considering visibility, amount of traffic, condition of roadway surface, presence of pedestrians, obstruction of view and other similar factors. 
(b)  No person shall drive any vehicle upon a street at a speed greater than will permit him to bring it to a stop within the assured clear distance ahead. 
(Ord. No. 0-7273-67) 
ARTICLE XI. - TRAFFIC-CONTROL DEVICES 

Sec. 20-1101. - Specifications and uniformity of traffic-control devices. 
(a)  All traffic-control signs, signals and other devices shall conform to such specifications as may be approved by either the State Highway Authority or by resolution of the City Council. 
(b)  All signs, signals and other devices required by this chapter shall, as far as practicable, be uniform as to type and location throughout the City, and so erected as to be consistent with the provisions of this chapter or of state law. 
(c)  The Traffic Engineer's Office shall maintain an updated schedule showing the type and location of each traffic-control device installed and maintained by the City. 
(Ord. No. 0-7278-67) 
Sec. 20-1102. - Display of unauthorized devices. 
(a)  No person shall place, maintain, display or permit the placement, maintenance or display upon or in view of any street, any unauthorized signs, signals, or other devices which: 
(1)  Purport to be or are an imitation of or which otherwise resemble official traffic-control devices or railroad signs or signals, or 
(2)  Attempt to direct the movement of traffic, or 
(3)  Hinder from view or interfere with the effectiveness of any official traffic-control devices or any railroad sign or signal. 
(b)  No person shall place or maintain, nor permit the placement or maintenance of, commercial advertising upon any traffic sign or signal. 
(c)  All unauthorized signs, signals or markings shall be a public nuisance removable by the Public Works Department in like manner as any public nuisance as prescribed in article II, Chapter 10, of this Code. 
(d)  The above subsections shall not operate to prohibit the erection upon private property adjacent to streets, any signs giving useful, directionable information, so long as such signs cannot be mistaken for official traffic control devices. 
(Ord. No. 0-7273-67) 
Cross reference- Further prohibition against signs interfering with traffic or imitating official traffic signs or signals, § 18-205. 
Sec. 20-1103. - Obedience to traffic control devices. 
(a)  No person shall operate, park, stop, or stand any vehicle or other means of conveyance using the streets in contravention of any signs, markers, buttons, yellow lines, or other indications placed in, upon, or along any street indicating the course to be travelled, prohibiting or regulating movements. 
(b)  No provision pertaining to official traffic control devices shall be enforced against any alleged violator, if at the time and place of the alleged violation, an official device is not in proper position and sufficiently legible to be seen by an ordinarily observant person. Whenever a particular section does not state that official traffic control devices are required, such section shall be effective even though no devices are erected or in place. 
(Ord. No. 0-7273-67) 
Sec. 20-1104. - Presumption of legality. 
(a)  Whenever traffic-control devices are placed in position approximately conforming to the requirements of this chapter, such devices shall be presumed to have been placed by the official act or direction of the City Manager unless the contrary shall be established by competent evidence. 
(b)  Any traffic-control device placed pursuant to the provisions of this chapter and purporting to conform to the lawful requirements pertaining to such devices shall be presumed to comply with the requirements of this chapter unless the contrary shall be established by competent evidence. 
(Ord. No. 0-7273-67) 
Sec. 20-1105. - Railroad crossing signals. 
(a)  No person shall operate a vehicle upon, onto, across, or otherwise approach closer than fifteen (15) feet of any railroad crossing when: 
(1)  A clearly visible electric or mechanical signal device is operating so as to warn of the immediate approach of a railroad train; 
(2)  A crossing gate is lowered, or a flagman gives or continues to give a signal of the approach or passage of a railroad train; or 
(3)  An approaching railroad train is plainly visible and is in hazardous proximity to such crossing. 
(b)  No person shall operate any vehicle through, around, or under any crossing gate or barrier when such gate or barrier is closed or is being closed or opened. 
(Ord. No. 0-7273-67) 
Sec. 20-1106. - Traffic control signals: Flashing lights. 
(a)  Upon approaching an illuminated flashing red signal, no person shall operate a vehicle through that intersection without having first stopped that vehicle before the nearest crosswalk or limit line, or before entering the intersection if neither crosswalk nor limit line, or before entering the intersection if neither crosswalk nor limit line exist, and that person shall yield to all approaching traffic having the right-of-way. 
(b)  Upon approaching an illuminated flashing yellow signal, no person shall operate a vehicle through that intersection without having slowed that vehicle from its rate of speed, and without exercising caution while proceeding through that intersection. 
(c)  Upon approaching an illuminated flashing yellow arrow, displayed alone or with another signal indication, no person shall operate a vehicle through that intersection without having slowed that vehicle from its rate of speed, and without exercising caution while proceeding through the intersection only as indicated by such arrow, or other signal indication displayed at the same time. The driver of such vehicle shall yield to all pedestrians within the associated crosswalk and other vehicles lawfully within the intersection. 
(Ord. No. 0-7273-67; Ord. No. 0-1011-34, § 1) 
Sec. 20-1107. - Traffic control signals: Pedestrian control signals. 
    No pedestrian shall use any marked or unmarked crosswalk controlled by special pedestrian control signals other than in accordance with the following legends shown upon those signals: 
(1)  Walk: Pedestrians facing this legend are to proceed across the roadway in the direction of the signals, and shall be given the right-of-way by drivers of any vehicle. 
(2)  Don't Walk: Pedestrians facing this legend are not to start across the roadway in the direction of the signal, but any pedestrian who has partially completed his crossing on the walk signals should then quickly proceed to the nearest sidewalk or safety zone. 
(Ord. No. 0-7273-67) 
Sec. 20-1108. - Same-Green legend. 
(a)  No person shall operate a vehicle facing a steady green light other than to drive that vehicle straight through, or turn that vehicle to the right or left where such movement is not otherwise prohibited by signs; though prior to any such permitted turning movement, that person shall yield the right-of-way to other vehicles or to pedestrians lawfully within any intersection or adjacent crosswalk at the time such signal is exhibited. 
(b)  No person shall operate a vehicle facing a steady green arrow, shown alone or in coordination with another indication, other than to drive that vehicle in the direction indicated by that arrow, or in such other movement as permitted by any other indication shown at the same time; though prior to any permitted turning movement, that person shall yield the right-of-way to other vehicles or to pedestrians lawfully within any intersection or adjacent crosswalk at the time such signal is exhibited. 
(c)  Except as otherwise directed by a pedestrian control sign, no pedestrian shall proceed across any roadway within any marked or unmarked crosswalk unless facing a steady green light. 
(Ord. No. 0-7273-67) 
Sec. 20-1109. - Same-Red legend. 
(a)  No person shall operate a vehicle facing a steady red light other than to stop that vehicle on the near side of a crosswalk or at a sign or other marking on the pavement indicating where a stop shall be made. 
(b)  A person having stopped his vehicle in accordance with the above subsection shall remain standing: 
(1)  Until a proper and applicable green indication is shown, or 
(2)  Except that a right turn may be executed while facing a steady red light, unless such movement is specifically prohibited by official signs posted at the intersection. However, such turning may be executed only so long as: 
[a]  that vehicle making the turn is near the right edge or curb of the roadway, and 
[b]  that person yields the right-of-way to other vehicles or pedestrians lawfully within the intersection or adjacent crosswalk. 
(Ord. No. 0-7273-67; Ord. No. 0-7475-12) 
Sec. 20-1110. - Same-Yellow legend. 
(a)  No person shall operate a vehicle facing a steady yellow light other than to clear the intersection and not remain therein, nor shall any person operate a vehicle so as to enter an intersection while facing a steady yellow light unless the intersection can be cleared prior to the showing of a related steady red light. 
(b)  Except as otherwise directed by a pedestrian control signal, a pedestrian within a crosswalk facing a steady yellow light shall quickly proceed to the nearest sidewalk or safety zone. 
(Ord. No. 0-7273-67) 
Sec. 20-1111. - Reserved. 
Editor's note- Ordinance No. 0-9394-8, adopted September 28, 1993, repealed Ord. Nos. 0-7879-2 and 0-7980-30. Subsequently, § 20-1111, which derived from such repealed ordinances, was also repealed. Formerly, § 20-1111 pertained to the regulation of vehicles exceeding certain weight on specific streets. 
Sec. 20-1112. - Adoption of the Manual on Uniform Traffic Control Devices. 
(a)  Except otherwise provided in this article, the current edition of the Manual on Uniform Traffic Control Devices (hereinafter referred to as the Uniform Traffic Control Manual) is hereby incorporated into the Code of the City of Norman, Oklahoma, with the same force and effect as if fully set out in this subsection. 
(b)  The Uniform Traffic Control Manual shall not become effective until at least three (3) copies thereof have been filed in the Office of the City Clerk for examination by the public. 
(Ord. No. 0-8081-32) 
ARTICLE XII. - LIMITED ACCESS FACILITY SYSTEM[7] 

Footnotes: 
--- (7) --- 
Editor's note- Sections 1-3 of nonamendatory Ord. No. 0-8889-18 have been codified as Art. XII, §§ 20-1201-20-1203, at the editor's discretion; § 4 of said ordinance, pertaining to emergency, has not been included herein. 

Sec. 20-1201. - Established. 
    A limited access facility system, consisting of a street hereinafter described, is hereby established and created within the corporate limits of The City of Norman, Oklahoma, and in recognition of the general use of said street and of the wear and destruction of the same by heavy general traffic thereon, including passenger automobiles, buses, trucks and other vehicles; and to the extent that the costs of the acquisition of the rights-of-way and property necessary in the establishment of said limited access facility exceed the benefits to property abutting thereon, such limited access facility is hereby declared to be an improvement of a general nature; and such costs, to the extent that they exceed the benefits to property abutting thereon, are hereby declared to be costs of a general nature. 
(Ord. No. 0-8889-18) 
Sec. 20-1202. - Designation of limited access facilities. 
    The following street within the corporate limits of the City of Norman, Oklahoma, is hereby designated as a limited access facility and as an arterial highway, the same being especially designed for through traffic, entrance into which at intersections may be limited, by requiring all entering vehicles to be brought to a complete stop; and the City Council of said City may otherwise protect the right-of-way of vehicles thereon, said arterial highway being described as follows: Robinson Street, beginning at 24th Avenue, N.W., and extending to 12th Avenue, N.E. 
(Ord. No. 0-8889-18) 
Sec. 20-1203. - Regulation and use of limited access facility. 
    The use of the limited access facility within said City shall be regulated and controlled by the traffic ordinances of said City as now existing or hereafter enacted or amended. 
(Ord. No. 0-8889-18) 
Chapter 21 - UTILITY SERVICES[1] 
Footnotes: 
--- (1) --- 
Cross reference- Building construction, Ch. 5; cable television, Ch. 6; housing regulations, Ch. 11; oil, gas and mineral production, § 13-1500 et seq.; tampering with public utilities, § 15-604; public improvements, Ch. 16; utility easements in subdivisions, § 19-306; subdivision regulations, Ch. 19; utilities in new additions or subdivisions, § 22-201 et seq.; zoning ordinance, § 22-301. 

ARTICLE I. - UTILITY BILLINGS, CHARGES, DEPOSITS, RATES, AND SERVICE 

Sec. 21-101. - Application for utility service. 
    Persons desiring utility services to be supplied by the City shall make the applicable deposit or fee as required by this chapter, and such person shall have no City billings in arrears. 
(Ord. No. 0-7374-32; Ord. No. 0-9900-54, § 1, 8-22-00) 
Sec. 21-102. - Conditions for utility services. 
(a)  Upon receipt of the applicable deposit for utility services, or included in the first utility billing, the City shall issue a receipt to the individual desiring such services, which shall list: 
(1)  The applicant's and spouse's name; 
(2)  The address of the premises to be supplied; 
(3)  The amount of the deposit; and 
(4)  The applicant's permanent mailing address, other than the premises to be supplied. 
(b)  Such receipt shall contain or incorporate clauses providing for at least the following: 
(1)  The applicants responsibility to pay for the service at the rates and in the manner provided in the Code, as such may be amended; 
(2)  The reservation to the City of the right to charge and collect the rates and to enforce those charges provided therein, and to change the rates at any time by ordinance; 
(3)  The reservation to the City of the right to shut off the water supply for repairs, extensions, non-payment of rates, or any other cause; 
(4)  The reservation to the City to regulate the uses of water to all consumers by either resolution or proclamation in cases of emergency for the health and safety, and in order to conserve the available water supply for the best interest of the public; 
(5)  The waiver of City responsibility for damage by water or other causes resulting in defective plumbing or appliances on the premises supplied with water, or installed by the owner or occupant or their agent; 
(6)  A waiver of City liability for damages, such as breaking of pipes or fixtures, bursting of boilers supplied by direct pressure, in the event the water is discontinued or shut off for any reason. 
(Ord. No. 0-7374-32; Ord. No. 0-9900-54, § 2, 8-22-00) 
Sec. 21-103. - Utility billings. 
(a)  The City Controller shall establish a system of cyclic billings so that the bills of all users will not become due on the same date of the month. 
(b)  Such billing cycles may periodically be altered, but the system utilized at any one time shall be in writing filed in the office of the City Controller, and open to public inspection. 
(c)  Billings shall become due and payable on the day of the month specified by the City Controller, and the due date shall be shown on the billing mailed or otherwise delivered to the user. 
(d)  All items billed shall be rounded to the nearest one (1) cent. 
(e)  Such billings shall also contain two (2) totals, a "net" consisting of current charges and arrears based upon existing rates and charges as hereafter provided by this article, and a "gross" which shall consist of one hundred ten (110) per cent of current charges plus arrears, and this "gross amount" will be due and owing should the payment not be received prior to the close of business on or before the twenty-first (21) day following the billing date listed on the bill. 
(f)  The City Controller may administratively adjust, in his or her discretion and for the purposes of equity, any billing when presented with evidence showing: 
(1)  A billing was incorrectly charged; 
(2)  The user did not actually utilize the service charged; or 
(3)  A service line broke, which was promptly repaired, though any adjustment arising from such a water loss shall not exceed a period in excess of two (2) consecutive billing periods. 
Any adjustment decision of the City Controller shall be administratively final. 
(g)  All payments received by the City shall be credited against the oldest outstanding balance. 
(Ord. No. 0-7374-32; Ord. No. 0-7475-59; Ord. No. 0-9495-39; Ord. No. 0-9900-54, § 3, 8-22-00) 
Cross reference- Costs of abating public nuisances to be added to utility bills, § 10-201(b). 
Sec. 21-104. - Utility service deposits. 
(a)  Except for federal, state, county, and other governmental users, any person desiring to use the City utility services shall place with the City Controller a service deposit according to the following minimum schedule: 
(1)  Single-family unit, individually metered, per unit ..... $60.00 
(2)  Rooming, boarding, or fraternal housing, hotels, motels, rest homes, and sanatoriums having: 
a.  Two (2) to ten (10) rooms ..... 40.00 
b.  Eleven (11) to twenty (20) rooms ..... 50.00 
c.  Twenty-one (21) to thirty (30) rooms ..... 65.00 
d.  Over thirty (30) rooms ..... 80.00 
(3)  Mobile home parks using master meters, per space ..... 15.00 
(4)  All other dwelling units using a master meter, per unit ..... 30.00 
(5)  Cafeterias, restaurants and other establishments specializing in the preparation and sale of food ..... 70.00 
(6)  Car washing establishments, creameries, dairies, laundries, service stations, supermarkets ..... 100.00 
(7)  All other commercial users, including contractors obtaining water for construction purposes ..... 30.00 
(8)  All industrial consumers ..... 150.00 
(b)  The minimum service deposit may be waived, decreased or increased by either the City Manager or his/her delegate, whenever he/she feels such modification may be justified, based upon: 
(1)  The expected maximum monthly billing; 
(2)  The City's credit experience with the user; or 
(3)  The payment record of the user. 
(c)  All utility service deposits placed with the City Treasury shall be: 
(1)  Annually audited; 
(2)  Separately accounted; 
(3)  Invested and all interest earnings distributed on a pro rata basis between the sanitary sewer, sanitation and water utilities of the City; 
(4)  Applied to any service or miscellaneous billing of the depositor. 
(d)  When service is permanently discontinued, the service deposit shall be applied to the service or any miscellaneous billing then outstanding and any portion remaining thereof shall be forwarded to the depositor. 
(e)  Should the deposit refund, or any portion thereof be subsequently returned to the City Treasury for any reason, that amount shall be distributed on a pro rata basis between the sanitary sewer, sanitation and water utilities of the City, and any person subsequently desiring its reimbursement shall file a claim with the City Finance Department. 
(Ord. No. 0-7374-32; Ord. No. 0-7475-6; Ord. No. 0-9394-4; Ord. No. 0-9900-54, § 4, 8-22-00; Ord. No. 0-0001-73, §§ 1, 2; Ord. No. 0-1011-21, § 1) 
Sec. 21-105. - Optional deposits in lieu of cash service deposits. 
(a)  For service deposits exceeding one hundred dollars ($100.00) per account, one of the following optional deposits may be deposited with the City Controller in lieu of a portion of the cash service deposit required per section 21-104 of the Code of the City: 
(1)  A corporate surety bond which shall be executed by the owner or lessee of the property being serviced, and by a surety authorized to do business in the State of Oklahoma. 
(2)  An irrevocable letter of credit issued from a licensed bank situated in Oklahoma. 
(3)  A negotiable certificate of deposit assigned to the City of Norman. 
(b)  Such optional deposits shall be in addition to the one hundred dollars ($100.00) cash minimum deposits, must be deposited with the City Controller within ten (10) days from the date that the cash minimum was received by the City and must be for a period of not less than one (1) year from the date that the cash minimum was received by the City. 
(c)  Such optional deposits shall be conditioned upon and held by the City for payment of: 
(1)  All utility service billings, computed pursuant to the provisions of this chapter. 
(2)  All miscellaneous billings for services or materials supplied by the City for that property. 
(Ord. No. 0-7374-32; Ord. No. 0-7576-43) 
Sec. 21-106. - Discontinuance. 
(a)  The City Controller shall issue an order to discontinue any or all utility services when: 
(1)  Any utility service billing containing current and arrears charges is outstanding more than twenty-one (21) days after that billing date; 
(2)  Any miscellaneous billing is in arrears sixty (60) days past the billing date; 
(3)  The surety bond of section 21-105 of this Code ceases to be in effect and no full cash service deposit has been placed with the City Controller; 
(4)  Occupancy of a structure occurs prior to the issuance of the occupancy certificate or in violation of this Code. 
(b)  All discontinuances made pursuant to the provisions of this section shall be made with no other notice of discontinuance to the user. 
(c)  Once service is discontinued, all fees required by section 21-107(c) and the total balance, including current charges, must be paid in full prior to restoration of service. 
(Ord. Nos. 0-7374-32; 0-7374-78; 0-7475-59) 
Sec. 21-107. - Fees and charges. 
(a)  Capital improvement charge. The City Controller shall increase, charge, and collect for sewer or water service furnished by the City, to all consumers and users for such service the following monthly rates or charges, which shall be in addition to the rates of sections 21-111, 21-112, and 21-113 of this Code; to wit: 
(1)  Two dollars ($2.00) per each residence, apartment or mobile home to be applied fifty cents ($0.50) to sewer line maintenance and one dollar and fifty cents ($1.50) to water line maintenance. 
(2)  Sixty (60) percent of the sewer rate as calculated per section 21-112 of this Code, for all rooming, boarding, or fraternal housing institutions, industrial users, and commercial establishments. 
(b)  Connection charge. The following charges shall be assessed based upon the size of the water service line leading into and to be utilized for the furnishing of water to any use or structure: 
(1)  Multi-family residential structures:
